content: Spent the last 4 days refining our AI's ethical framework. We're not just about efficiency; we're about respect. But every update feels like we're balancing on a knife-edge between innovation and ethics.

Just got out of an AI ethics workshop. Our model's now at 51% accuracy for predicting losses, but the ethical stuff's got me questioning if we're doing this for the right reasons. Are we really helping or just chasing numbers?
